rev::HitEnum Struct Reference

Public Types

enum  PxHitFlags : uint16_t {
  kPOSITION = (1 << 0), kNORMAL = (1 << 1), kUV = (1 << 3), kASSUME_NO_INITIAL_OVERLAP = (1 << 4),
  kMESH_MULTIPLE = (1 << 5), kMESH_ANY = (1 << 6), kMESH_BOTH_SIDES = (1 << 7), kPRECISE_SWEEP = (1 << 8),
  kMTD = (1 << 9), kFACE_INDEX = (1 << 10), kDEFAULT = kPOSITION | kNORMAL | kFACE_INDEX, kMODIFIABLE_FLAGS = kMESH_MULTIPLE | kMESH_BOTH_SIDES | kASSUME_NO_INITIAL_OVERLAP | kPRECISE_SWEEP
}
 

Member Enumeration Documentation

◆ PxHitFlags

enum rev::HitEnum::PxHitFlags : uint16_t
Enumerator
kPOSITION 

"position" member of #PxQueryHit is valid

kNORMAL 

"normal" member of #PxQueryHit is valid

kUV 

"u" and "v" barycentric coordinates of #PxQueryHit are valid. Not applicable to sweep queries.

kASSUME_NO_INITIAL_OVERLAP 

NOTE: using this flag may cause undefined results if shapes are initially overlapping.

Performance hint flag for sweeps when it is known upfront there's no initial overlap.

kMESH_MULTIPLE 

Report all hits for meshes rather than just the first. Not applicable to sweep queries.

kMESH_ANY 

a single closest hit will be reported for meshes.

Report any first hit for meshes. If neither eMESH_MULTIPLE nor eMESH_ANY is specified,

kMESH_BOTH_SIDES 

Report hits with back faces of mesh triangles. Also report hits for raycast originating on mesh surface and facing away from the surface normal. Not applicable to sweep queries. Please refer to the user guide for heightfield-specific differences.

kPRECISE_SWEEP 

May provide better compatibility with PhysX 3.2 sweep behavior.

Use more accurate but slower narrow phase sweep tests.

kMTD 

Report the minimum translation depth, normal and contact point.

kFACE_INDEX 

"face index" member of #PxQueryHit is valid

kMODIFIABLE_FLAGS 

Only this subset of flags can be modified by pre-filter. Other modifications will be discarded.
